Which would be the worst election:
 
 Quayle Vs Dukakis or Huckabee vs Clinton?

In my opinion, for an election to be bad you need A) two bad candidates and B) to not know which is the lesser of the two evils. If Huckabee gets the nomination then it doesn't matter who the other person is. Huckabee vs. a pile of old sweat socks and the choice would still be clear. That's why I voted for Q v D.

Well lets see Clinton(the candidate that believes in freedom and civil liberties) VS Huckabee(the candidate who wants to replace the constitution with the bible)
 
 It will be a landslide in Clintons favor. People are tired of christianist politicians who only believe in their own religious freedom and no one elses.

I love how people assume Huckabee would just make the Bible law yet for 12 years in Arkansas he didn't. Even one of the liberal members on this forum who lived in Arkansas conceded that Huckabee was "not that bad".

In my opinion, for an election to be bad you need A) two bad candidates and B) to not know which is the lesser of the two evils. If Huckabee gets the nomination then it doesn't matter who the other person is. Huckabee vs. a pile of old sweat socks and the choice would still be clear. That's why I voted for Q v D.

 
 Hence the problem continues. The American sheeple continue to fall victim to the politcal machine. By your definition, all the elections in the past 20 years have been bad. If you are going to the voting booth and saying: "well, X is a piece of ####, but he's not as bad as Y, so I'll vote for X", then you should not be voting. People that go to the ballot box and pick the lesser of 2 evils are a large part of what is wrong with American politics. Have the self respect to demand something better.

I love how people assume Huckabee would just make the Bible law yet for 12 years in Arkansas he didn't. Even one of the liberal members on this forum who lived in Arkansas conceded that Huckabee was "not that bad".

 Let it be known that said liberal wouldn't dare give Huckabee such a soapbox or such power.
